page.title: 05The Hamlet of Preston Bagot
page.content: Most of this area is uncultivated grassland.Housing comes into three categories: a)Farmworkers/old retired country people in cottages. b)Farmers in large well kept houses. c)Non-agricultural workers who live in very well kept large houses.These have been converted from old cottages or newly built.All with large well kept gardens i.e.commuters/top jobs. In the area is one pub which has a passing trade (and caters for families) as it is on the main Warwick to Henley road. The canal along this stretch is not well kept.The towpath needs attention as do the canal banks.It is in regular use however,mainly by holiday craft (not as busy as the Hatton section) The area is very rural i.e.no shops.
